item.title: Sarah add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Sarah add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jenkin Lloyd Jones
item.description: "Anyone who imagines that bliss is normal is going to waste a lot of time running around shouting that he has been robbed. The fact is that most putts don’t drop, most beef is tough, most children grow up to be just like people, most successful marriages require a high degree of mutual toleration, and most jobs are more often dull than otherwise. Life is just like an old time rail journey ... delays, sidetracks, smoke, dust, cinders, and jolts, interspersed only occasionally by beautiful vistas and thrilling bursts of speed. The trick is to thank the Lord for letting you have the ride." -- Jenkin Lloyd Jones

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "If Life Gets Too Hard To Stand, Kneel." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I've learned that you can tell a lot about a person by the way (s)he handles these three things: a rainy day, lost luggage, and tangled Christmas tree lights." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Amanda Cross
item.description: "A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar." -- Amanda Cross

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Speaking personally, you can have my gun, but you'll take my book when you pry my cold, dead fingers off of the binding." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage." -- Roald Dahl
